result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Craig E. Joers was found guilty of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).
  • Craig E. Joers was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Court costs and DNA to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.
Defendant may have contact with his son upon the mother's approval.
Defendant may have contact with his step-daughter upon the mother's approval.
Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

supervisions.notes: Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 568 days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs previously imposed are to be converted to a civil judgement.

No Contact with the victim listed in the criminal complaint unless approved by the victim and the agent. Comply with any family court orders in place.   Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program, but  
IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

superMiscConds.notes:
Fine to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
DNA Surcharge to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision/Probation.
Submit to an AODA Assesment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

Maintain absolute sobriety.

Provide DNA sample if not previously done.

This hearing has met the statutory standards for video conferencing. States makes a statement to the court. Attorney Wolff makes a statement to the court. Defendant makes a statement to the court.

Count 1
Years Imprisonment (Credit - 568 days)
7 Years of Initial Confinement
13 Years of Extended Supervision

Defendant Craig E. Joers in court, in custody, with attorney Samuel W. Benedict.   Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for the sentencing. Court imposed the following sentence: 

  The Defendant was given the following: as to count 1

WITHHELD SENTENCE;

TERM OF PROBATION:  8 YEAR(S);

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
 
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Defendant may have contact with his son upon the mothers approval
*Defendant may have contact with his step-daughter upon the mother's approval  
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.
 
COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Defendant given credit for 1 year and 97 days if revoked


  The Defendant was sentenced to the following:  Count 3

IMPOSED SENTENCE OF:   

4 YEARS IMPRISONMENT 
  -  2 YEARS OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION. 

*D/L REVOCATION: 36 months.
*IGNITION INTERLOCK: 36 months.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
*Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
*Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
*Attendance at a Victim Impact Panel during the period of probation.
*DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done (no surcharges).

FINE:  $2023.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision or any prison monies per statute)
DNA Surcharge $250.00 (to be paid as condition of extended supervision or any prison monies per statute)

Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program. 

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
